CarConnection - Class in at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.server.connections
This class is used to communicate with a car via a TCP-connection (see Connection class for more information on the basic functionalities).
It holds the reference to the PhoneConnection of a linked phone (if any) in order to be able to forward information such as sensor-data to it.
This class provides the means for a linked phone to send data (e.g.

connect - Static variable in class at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.server.helper.Keywords
 
Connection - Class in at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.server.connections
This abstract runnable provides basic functionality to communicate with any device that is connected to this server via a TCP-connection.
This class holds the reference to exactly one TCP-connection with another device, which means that every connection is handled in its own thread.
Basic functionalities are:
-) Write and read Strings to and from the TCP-Socket that connects the server to the device.
-) Write and read JSON Strings to and from the TCP-Socket that can be generated by HashMaps.
-) inform the main thread about certain events via the operationQueue.

The class also contains a list of listeners that can register themselves to get informed about data that is received via this classes TCP-connection.

Following is a list of JSON-Keywords, that can be part of a message (value range not enforced by server):
Key Value range/type Description id long or String to register at the server.
Connection(Socket, LinkedBlockingQueue<QueueElement>) - Constructor for class at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.server.connections.Connection

A ConnectionAcceptor listens to new incoming TCP-connections on the specified port until a new connection is available.
